intro: Pulsatilla kioviensis, commonly known as the Kioviensis pasqueflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other spring-blooming plants. The plant produces showy, cup-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color, with a hairy appearance. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
